51static int
52nv04_crtc_mode_set_base(struct drm_crtc *crtc, int x, int y,
53 struct drm_framebuffer *old_fb);
54
55static void
56crtc_wr_cio_state(struct drm_crtc *crtc, struct nv04_crtc_reg *crtcstate, int index)
57{
58 NVWriteVgaCrtc(crtc->dev, nouveau_crtc(crtc)->index, index,
59 crtcstate->CRTC[index]);
60}
61
62static void nv_crtc_set_digital_vibrance(struct drm_crtc *crtc, int level)
63{
64 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
65 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
66 struct nv04_crtc_reg *regp = &nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg.crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index];
67
68 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_CSB] = nv_crtc->saturation = level;
69 if (nv_crtc->saturation && nv_gf4_disp_arch(crtc->dev)) {
70 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_CSB] = 0x80;
71 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_5B] = nv_crtc->saturation << 2;
72 crtc_wr_cio_state(crtc, regp, NV_CIO_CRE_5B);
73 }
74 crtc_wr_cio_state(crtc, regp, NV_CIO_CRE_CSB);
75}
76
77static void nv_crtc_set_image_sharpening(struct drm_crtc *crtc, int level)
78{
79 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
80 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
81 struct nv04_crtc_reg *regp = &nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg.crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index];
82
83 nv_crtc->sharpness = level;
84 if (level < 0) /* blur is in hw range 0x3f -> 0x20 */
85 level += 0x40;
86 regp->ramdac_634 = level;
87 NVWriteRAMDAC(crtc->dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_PRAMDAC_634, regp->ramdac_634);
88}
89
90#define PLLSEL_VPLL1_MASK \
91 (NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_SOURCE_PROG_VPLL \
92 | NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_VCLK_RATIO_DB2)
93#define PLLSEL_VPLL2_MASK \
94 (NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_PLL_SOURCE_VPLL2 \
95 | NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_VCLK2_RATIO_DB2)
96#define PLLSEL_TV_MASK \
97 (NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_TV_VSCLK1 \
98 | NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_TV_PCLK1 \
99 | NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_TV_VSCLK2 \
100 | NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_TV_PCLK2)
101
102/* NV4x 0x40.. pll notes:
103 * gpu pll: 0x4000 + 0x4004
104 * ?gpu? pll: 0x4008 + 0x400c
105 * vpll1: 0x4010 + 0x4014
106 * vpll2: 0x4018 + 0x401c
107 * mpll: 0x4020 + 0x4024
108 * mpll: 0x4038 + 0x403c
109 *
110 * the first register of each pair has some unknown details:
111 * bits 0-7: redirected values from elsewhere? (similar to PLL_SETUP_CONTROL?)
112 * bits 20-23: (mpll) something to do with post divider?
113 * bits 28-31: related to single stage mode? (bit 8/12)
114 */
115
116static void nv_crtc_calc_state_ext(struct drm_crtc *crtc, struct drm_display_mode * mode, int dot_clock)
117{
118 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
119 struct nouveau_drm *drm = nouveau_drm(dev);
120 struct nvkm_bios *bios = nvxx_bios(&drm->device);
121 struct nvkm_clk *clk = nvxx_clk(&drm->device);
122 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
123 struct nv04_mode_state *state = &nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg;
124 struct nv04_crtc_reg *regp = &state->crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index];
125 struct nvkm_pll_vals *pv = &regp->pllvals;
126 struct nvbios_pll pll_lim;
127
128 if (nvbios_pll_parse(bios, nv_crtc->index ? PLL_VPLL1 : PLL_VPLL0,
129 &pll_lim))
130 return;
131
132 /* NM2 == 0 is used to determine single stage mode on two stage plls */
133 pv->NM2 = 0;
134
135 /* for newer nv4x the blob uses only the first stage of the vpll below a
136 * certain clock. for a certain nv4b this is 150MHz. since the max
137 * output frequency of the first stage for this card is 300MHz, it is
138 * assumed the threshold is given by vco1 maxfreq/2
139 */
140 /* for early nv4x, specifically nv40 and *some* nv43 (devids 0 and 6,
141 * not 8, others unknown), the blob always uses both plls. no problem
142 * has yet been observed in allowing the use a single stage pll on all
143 * nv43 however. the behaviour of single stage use is untested on nv40
144 */
145 if (drm->device.info.chipset > 0x40 && dot_clock <= (pll_lim.vco1.max_freq / 2))
146 memset(&pll_lim.vco2, 0, sizeof(pll_lim.vco2));
147
148
149 if (!clk->pll_calc(clk, &pll_lim, dot_clock, pv))
150 return;
151
152 state->pllsel &= PLLSEL_VPLL1_MASK | PLLSEL_VPLL2_MASK | PLLSEL_TV_MASK;
153
154 /* The blob uses this always, so let's do the same */
155 if (drm->device.info.family == NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_CURIE)
156 state->pllsel |= NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_USE_VPLL2_TRUE;
157 /* again nv40 and some nv43 act more like nv3x as described above */
158 if (drm->device.info.chipset < 0x41)
159 state->pllsel |= NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_SOURCE_PROG_MPLL |
160 NV_PRAMDAC_PLL_COEFF_SELECT_SOURCE_PROG_NVPLL;
161 state->pllsel |= nv_crtc->index ? PLLSEL_VPLL2_MASK : PLLSEL_VPLL1_MASK;
162
163 if (pv->NM2)
164 NV_DEBUG(drm, "vpll: n1 %d n2 %d m1 %d m2 %d log2p %d\n",
165 pv->N1, pv->N2, pv->M1, pv->M2, pv->log2P);
166 else
167 NV_DEBUG(drm, "vpll: n %d m %d log2p %d\n",
168 pv->N1, pv->M1, pv->log2P);
169
170 nv_crtc->cursor.set_offset(nv_crtc, nv_crtc->cursor.offset);
171}
172
173static void
174nv_crtc_dpms(struct drm_crtc *crtc, int mode)
175{
176 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
177 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
178 struct nouveau_drm *drm = nouveau_drm(dev);
179 unsigned char seq1 = 0, crtc17 = 0;
180 unsigned char crtc1A;
181
182 NV_DEBUG(drm, "Setting dpms mode %d on CRTC %d\n", mode,
183 nv_crtc->index);
184
185 if (nv_crtc->last_dpms == mode) /* Don't do unnecessary mode changes. */
186 return;
187
188 nv_crtc->last_dpms = mode;
189
190 if (nv_two_heads(dev))
191 NVSetOwner(dev, nv_crtc->index);
192
193 /* nv4ref indicates these two RPC1 bits inhibit h/v sync */
194 crtc1A = NVReadVgaCrtc(dev, nv_crtc->index,
195 NV_CIO_CRE_RPC1_INDEX) & ~0xC0;
196 switch (mode) {
197 case DRM_MODE_DPMS_STANDBY:
198 /* Screen: Off; HSync: Off, VSync: On -- Not Supported */
199 seq1 = 0x20;
200 crtc17 = 0x80;
201 crtc1A |= 0x80;
202 break;
203 case DRM_MODE_DPMS_SUSPEND:
204 /* Screen: Off; HSync: On, VSync: Off -- Not Supported */
205 seq1 = 0x20;
206 crtc17 = 0x80;
207 crtc1A |= 0x40;
208 break;
209 case DRM_MODE_DPMS_OFF:
210 /* Screen: Off; HSync: Off, VSync: Off */
211 seq1 = 0x20;
212 crtc17 = 0x00;
213 crtc1A |= 0xC0;
214 break;
215 case DRM_MODE_DPMS_ON:
216 default:
217 /* Screen: On; HSync: On, VSync: On */
218 seq1 = 0x00;
219 crtc17 = 0x80;
220 break;
221 }
222
223 NVVgaSeqReset(dev, nv_crtc->index, true);
224 /* Each head has it's own sequencer, so we can turn it off when we want */
225 seq1 |= (NVReadVgaSeq(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_VIO_SR_CLOCK_INDEX) & ~0x20);
226 NVWriteVgaSeq(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_VIO_SR_CLOCK_INDEX, seq1);
227 crtc17 |= (NVReadVgaCrtc(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_CIO_CR_MODE_INDEX) & ~0x80);
228 mdelay(10);
229 NVWriteVgaCrtc(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_CIO_CR_MODE_INDEX, crtc17);
230 NVVgaSeqReset(dev, nv_crtc->index, false);
231
232 NVWriteVgaCrtc(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_CIO_CRE_RPC1_INDEX, crtc1A);
233}
234
235static bool
236nv_crtc_mode_fixup(struct drm_crtc *crtc, const struct drm_display_mode *mode,
237 struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
238{
239 return true;
240}
241
242static void
243nv_crtc_mode_set_vga(struct drm_crtc *crtc, struct drm_display_mode *mode)
244{
245 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
246 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
247 struct nv04_crtc_reg *regp = &nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg.crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index];
248 struct drm_framebuffer *fb = crtc->primary->fb;
249
250 /* Calculate our timings */
251 int horizDisplay = (mode->crtc_hdisplay >> 3) - 1;
252 int horizStart = (mode->crtc_hsync_start >> 3) + 1;
253 int horizEnd = (mode->crtc_hsync_end >> 3) + 1;
254 int horizTotal = (mode->crtc_htotal >> 3) - 5;
255 int horizBlankStart = (mode->crtc_hdisplay >> 3) - 1;
256 int horizBlankEnd = (mode->crtc_htotal >> 3) - 1;
257 int vertDisplay = mode->crtc_vdisplay - 1;
258 int vertStart = mode->crtc_vsync_start - 1;
259 int vertEnd = mode->crtc_vsync_end - 1;
260 int vertTotal = mode->crtc_vtotal - 2;
261 int vertBlankStart = mode->crtc_vdisplay - 1;
262 int vertBlankEnd = mode->crtc_vtotal - 1;
263
264 struct drm_encoder *encoder;
265 bool fp_output = false;
266
267 list_for_each_entry(encoder, &dev->mode_config.encoder_list, head) {
268 struct nouveau_encoder *nv_encoder = nouveau_encoder(encoder);
269
270 if (encoder->crtc == crtc &&
271 (nv_encoder->dcb->type == DCB_OUTPUT_LVDS ||
272 nv_encoder->dcb->type == DCB_OUTPUT_TMDS))
273 fp_output = true;
274 }
275
276 if (fp_output) {
277 vertStart = vertTotal - 3;
278 vertEnd = vertTotal - 2;
279 vertBlankStart = vertStart;
280 horizStart = horizTotal - 5;
281 horizEnd = horizTotal - 2;
282 horizBlankEnd = horizTotal + 4;
283#if 0
284 if (dev->overlayAdaptor && drm->device.info.family >= NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_CELSIUS)
285 /* This reportedly works around some video overlay bandwidth problems */
286 horizTotal += 2;
287#endif
288 }
289
290 if (mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_INTERLACE)
291 vertTotal |= 1;
292
293#if 0
294 ErrorF("horizDisplay: 0x%X \n", horizDisplay);
295 ErrorF("horizStart: 0x%X \n", horizStart);
296 ErrorF("horizEnd: 0x%X \n", horizEnd);
297 ErrorF("horizTotal: 0x%X \n", horizTotal);
298 ErrorF("horizBlankStart: 0x%X \n", horizBlankStart);
299 ErrorF("horizBlankEnd: 0x%X \n", horizBlankEnd);
300 ErrorF("vertDisplay: 0x%X \n", vertDisplay);
301 ErrorF("vertStart: 0x%X \n", vertStart);
302 ErrorF("vertEnd: 0x%X \n", vertEnd);
303 ErrorF("vertTotal: 0x%X \n", vertTotal);
304 ErrorF("vertBlankStart: 0x%X \n", vertBlankStart);
305 ErrorF("vertBlankEnd: 0x%X \n", vertBlankEnd);
306#endif
307
308 /*
309 * compute correct Hsync & Vsync polarity
310 */
311 if ((mode->flags & (DRM_MODE_FLAG_PHSYNC | DRM_MODE_FLAG_NHSYNC))
312 && (mode->flags & (DRM_MODE_FLAG_PVSYNC | DRM_MODE_FLAG_NVSYNC))) {
313
314 regp->MiscOutReg = 0x23;
315 if (mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_NHSYNC)
316 regp->MiscOutReg |= 0x40;
317 if (mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_NVSYNC)
318 regp->MiscOutReg |= 0x80;
319 } else {
320 int vdisplay = mode->vdisplay;
321 if (mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_DBLSCAN)
322 vdisplay *= 2;
323 if (mode->vscan > 1)
324 vdisplay *= mode->vscan;
325 if (vdisplay < 400)
326 regp->MiscOutReg = 0xA3; /* +hsync -vsync */
327 else if (vdisplay < 480)
328 regp->MiscOutReg = 0x63; /* -hsync +vsync */
329 else if (vdisplay < 768)
330 regp->MiscOutReg = 0xE3; /* -hsync -vsync */
331 else
332 regp->MiscOutReg = 0x23; /* +hsync +vsync */
333 }
334
335 /*
336 * Time Sequencer
337 */
338 regp->Sequencer[NV_VIO_SR_RESET_INDEX] = 0x00;
339 /* 0x20 disables the sequencer */
340 if (mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_CLKDIV2)
341 regp->Sequencer[NV_VIO_SR_CLOCK_INDEX] = 0x29;
342 else
343 regp->Sequencer[NV_VIO_SR_CLOCK_INDEX] = 0x21;
344 regp->Sequencer[NV_VIO_SR_PLANE_MASK_INDEX] = 0x0F;
345 regp->Sequencer[NV_VIO_SR_CHAR_MAP_INDEX] = 0x00;
346 regp->Sequencer[NV_VIO_SR_MEM_MODE_INDEX] = 0x0E;
347
348 /*
349 * CRTC
350 */
351 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_HDT_INDEX] = horizTotal;
352 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_HDE_INDEX] = horizDisplay;
353 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_HBS_INDEX] = horizBlankStart;
354 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_HBE_INDEX] = (1 << 7) |
355 XLATE(horizBlankEnd, 0, NV_CIO_CR_HBE_4_0);
356 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_HRS_INDEX] = horizStart;
357 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_HRE_INDEX] = XLATE(horizBlankEnd, 5, NV_CIO_CR_HRE_HBE_5) |
358 XLATE(horizEnd, 0, NV_CIO_CR_HRE_4_0);
359 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_VDT_INDEX] = vertTotal;
360 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_OVL_INDEX] = XLATE(vertStart, 9, NV_CIO_CR_OVL_VRS_9) |
361 XLATE(vertDisplay, 9, NV_CIO_CR_OVL_VDE_9) |
362 XLATE(vertTotal, 9, NV_CIO_CR_OVL_VDT_9) |
363 (1 << 4) |
364 XLATE(vertBlankStart, 8, NV_CIO_CR_OVL_VBS_8) |
365 XLATE(vertStart, 8, NV_CIO_CR_OVL_VRS_8) |
366 XLATE(vertDisplay, 8, NV_CIO_CR_OVL_VDE_8) |
367 XLATE(vertTotal, 8, NV_CIO_CR_OVL_VDT_8);
368 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_RSAL_INDEX] = 0x00;
369 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_CELL_HT_INDEX] = ((mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_DBLSCAN) ? MASK(NV_CIO_CR_CELL_HT_SCANDBL) : 0) |
370 1 << 6 |
371 XLATE(vertBlankStart, 9, NV_CIO_CR_CELL_HT_VBS_9);
372 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_CURS_ST_INDEX] = 0x00;
373 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_CURS_END_INDEX] = 0x00;
374 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_SA_HI_INDEX] = 0x00;
375 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_SA_LO_INDEX] = 0x00;
376 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_TCOFF_HI_INDEX] = 0x00;
377 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_TCOFF_LO_INDEX] = 0x00;
378 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_VRS_INDEX] = vertStart;
379 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_VRE_INDEX] = 1 << 5 | XLATE(vertEnd, 0, NV_CIO_CR_VRE_3_0);
380 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_VDE_INDEX] = vertDisplay;
381 /* framebuffer can be larger than crtc scanout area. */
382 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_OFFSET_INDEX] = fb->pitches[0] / 8;
383 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_ULINE_INDEX] = 0x00;
384 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_VBS_INDEX] = vertBlankStart;
385 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_VBE_INDEX] = vertBlankEnd;
386 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_MODE_INDEX] = 0x43;
387 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_LCOMP_INDEX] = 0xff;
388
389 /*
390 * Some extended CRTC registers (they are not saved with the rest of the vga regs).
391 */
392
393 /* framebuffer can be larger than crtc scanout area. */
394 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_RPC0_INDEX] =
395 XLATE(fb->pitches[0] / 8, 8, NV_CIO_CRE_RPC0_OFFSET_10_8);
396 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_42] =
397 XLATE(fb->pitches[0] / 8, 11, NV_CIO_CRE_42_OFFSET_11);
398 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_RPC1_INDEX] = mode->crtc_hdisplay < 1280 ?
399 MASK(NV_CIO_CRE_RPC1_LARGE) : 0x00;
400 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_LSR_INDEX] = XLATE(horizBlankEnd, 6, NV_CIO_CRE_LSR_HBE_6) |
401 XLATE(vertBlankStart, 10, NV_CIO_CRE_LSR_VBS_10) |
402 XLATE(vertStart, 10, NV_CIO_CRE_LSR_VRS_10) |
403 XLATE(vertDisplay, 10, NV_CIO_CRE_LSR_VDE_10) |
404 XLATE(vertTotal, 10, NV_CIO_CRE_LSR_VDT_10);
405 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_HEB__INDEX] = XLATE(horizStart, 8, NV_CIO_CRE_HEB_HRS_8) |
406 XLATE(horizBlankStart, 8, NV_CIO_CRE_HEB_HBS_8) |
407 XLATE(horizDisplay, 8, NV_CIO_CRE_HEB_HDE_8) |
408 XLATE(horizTotal, 8, NV_CIO_CRE_HEB_HDT_8);
409 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_EBR_INDEX] = XLATE(vertBlankStart, 11, NV_CIO_CRE_EBR_VBS_11) |
410 XLATE(vertStart, 11, NV_CIO_CRE_EBR_VRS_11) |
411 XLATE(vertDisplay, 11, NV_CIO_CRE_EBR_VDE_11) |
412 XLATE(vertTotal, 11, NV_CIO_CRE_EBR_VDT_11);
413
414 if (mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_INTERLACE) {
415 horizTotal = (horizTotal >> 1) & ~1;
416 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_ILACE__INDEX] = horizTotal;
417 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_HEB__INDEX] |= XLATE(horizTotal, 8, NV_CIO_CRE_HEB_ILC_8);
418 } else
419 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_ILACE__INDEX] = 0xff; /* interlace off */
420
421 /*
422 * Graphics Display Controller
423 */
424 regp->Graphics[NV_VIO_GX_SR_INDEX] = 0x00;
425 regp->Graphics[NV_VIO_GX_SREN_INDEX] = 0x00;
426 regp->Graphics[NV_VIO_GX_CCOMP_INDEX] = 0x00;
427 regp->Graphics[NV_VIO_GX_ROP_INDEX] = 0x00;
428 regp->Graphics[NV_VIO_GX_READ_MAP_INDEX] = 0x00;
429 regp->Graphics[NV_VIO_GX_MODE_INDEX] = 0x40; /* 256 color mode */
430 regp->Graphics[NV_VIO_GX_MISC_INDEX] = 0x05; /* map 64k mem + graphic mode */
431 regp->Graphics[NV_VIO_GX_DONT_CARE_INDEX] = 0x0F;
432 regp->Graphics[NV_VIO_GX_BIT_MASK_INDEX] = 0xFF;
433
434 regp->Attribute[0] = 0x00; /* standard colormap translation */
435 regp->Attribute[1] = 0x01;
436 regp->Attribute[2] = 0x02;
437 regp->Attribute[3] = 0x03;
438 regp->Attribute[4] = 0x04;
439 regp->Attribute[5] = 0x05;
440 regp->Attribute[6] = 0x06;
441 regp->Attribute[7] = 0x07;
442 regp->Attribute[8] = 0x08;
443 regp->Attribute[9] = 0x09;
444 regp->Attribute[10] = 0x0A;
445 regp->Attribute[11] = 0x0B;
446 regp->Attribute[12] = 0x0C;
447 regp->Attribute[13] = 0x0D;
448 regp->Attribute[14] = 0x0E;
449 regp->Attribute[15] = 0x0F;
450 regp->Attribute[NV_CIO_AR_MODE_INDEX] = 0x01; /* Enable graphic mode */
451 /* Non-vga */
452 regp->Attribute[NV_CIO_AR_OSCAN_INDEX] = 0x00;
453 regp->Attribute[NV_CIO_AR_PLANE_INDEX] = 0x0F; /* enable all color planes */
454 regp->Attribute[NV_CIO_AR_HPP_INDEX] = 0x00;
455 regp->Attribute[NV_CIO_AR_CSEL_INDEX] = 0x00;
456}
457
458/**
459 * Sets up registers for the given mode/adjusted_mode pair.
460 *
461 * The clocks, CRTCs and outputs attached to this CRTC must be off.
462 *
463 * This shouldn't enable any clocks, CRTCs, or outputs, but they should
464 * be easily turned on/off after this.
465 */
466static void
467nv_crtc_mode_set_regs(struct drm_crtc *crtc, struct drm_display_mode * mode)
468{
469 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
470 struct nouveau_drm *drm = nouveau_drm(dev);
471 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
472 struct nv04_crtc_reg *regp = &nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg.crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index];
473 struct nv04_crtc_reg *savep = &nv04_display(dev)->saved_reg.crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index];
474 struct drm_encoder *encoder;
475 bool lvds_output = false, tmds_output = false, tv_output = false,
476 off_chip_digital = false;
477
478 list_for_each_entry(encoder, &dev->mode_config.encoder_list, head) {
479 struct nouveau_encoder *nv_encoder = nouveau_encoder(encoder);
480 bool digital = false;
481
482 if (encoder->crtc != crtc)
483 continue;
484
485 if (nv_encoder->dcb->type == DCB_OUTPUT_LVDS)
486 digital = lvds_output = true;
487 if (nv_encoder->dcb->type == DCB_OUTPUT_TV)
488 tv_output = true;
489 if (nv_encoder->dcb->type == DCB_OUTPUT_TMDS)
490 digital = tmds_output = true;
491 if (nv_encoder->dcb->location != DCB_LOC_ON_CHIP && digital)
492 off_chip_digital = true;
493 }
494
495 /* Registers not directly related to the (s)vga mode */
496
497 /* What is the meaning of this register? */
498 /* A few popular values are 0x18, 0x1c, 0x38, 0x3c */
499 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_ENH_INDEX] = savep->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_ENH_INDEX] & ~(1<<5);
500
501 regp->crtc_eng_ctrl = 0;
502 /* Except for rare conditions I2C is enabled on the primary crtc */
503 if (nv_crtc->index == 0)
504 regp->crtc_eng_ctrl |= NV_CRTC_FSEL_I2C;
505#if 0
506 /* Set overlay to desired crtc. */
507 if (dev->overlayAdaptor) {
508 NVPortPrivPtr pPriv = GET_OVERLAY_PRIVATE(dev);
509 if (pPriv->overlayCRTC == nv_crtc->index)
510 regp->crtc_eng_ctrl |= NV_CRTC_FSEL_OVERLAY;
511 }
512#endif
513
514 /* ADDRESS_SPACE_PNVM is the same as setting HCUR_ASI */
515 regp->cursor_cfg = NV_PCRTC_CURSOR_CONFIG_CUR_LINES_64 |
516 NV_PCRTC_CURSOR_CONFIG_CUR_PIXELS_64 |
517 NV_PCRTC_CURSOR_CONFIG_ADDRESS_SPACE_PNVM;
518 if (drm->device.info.chipset >= 0x11)
519 regp->cursor_cfg |= NV_PCRTC_CURSOR_CONFIG_CUR_BPP_32;
520 if (mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_DBLSCAN)
521 regp->cursor_cfg |= NV_PCRTC_CURSOR_CONFIG_DOUBLE_SCAN_ENABLE;
522
523 /* Unblock some timings */
524 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_53] = 0;
525 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_54] = 0;
526
527 /* 0x00 is disabled, 0x11 is lvds, 0x22 crt and 0x88 tmds */
528 if (lvds_output)
529 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_SCRATCH3__INDEX] = 0x11;
530 else if (tmds_output)
531 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_SCRATCH3__INDEX] = 0x88;
532 else
533 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_SCRATCH3__INDEX] = 0x22;
534
535 /* These values seem to vary */
536 /* This register seems to be used by the bios to make certain decisions on some G70 cards? */
537 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_SCRATCH4__INDEX] = savep->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_SCRATCH4__INDEX];
538
539 nv_crtc_set_digital_vibrance(crtc, nv_crtc->saturation);
540
541 /* probably a scratch reg, but kept for cargo-cult purposes:
542 * bit0: crtc0?, head A
543 * bit6: lvds, head A
544 * bit7: (only in X), head A
545 */
546 if (nv_crtc->index == 0)
547 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_4B] = savep->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_4B] | 0x80;
548
549 /* The blob seems to take the current value from crtc 0, add 4 to that
550 * and reuse the old value for crtc 1 */
551 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_TVOUT_LATENCY] = nv04_display(dev)->saved_reg.crtc_reg[0].CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_TVOUT_LATENCY];
552 if (!nv_crtc->index)
553 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_TVOUT_LATENCY] += 4;
554
555 /* the blob sometimes sets |= 0x10 (which is the same as setting |=
556 * 1 << 30 on 0x60.830), for no apparent reason */
557 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_59] = off_chip_digital;
558
559 if (drm->device.info.family >= NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_RANKINE)
560 regp->CRTC[0x9f] = off_chip_digital ? 0x11 : 0x1;
561
562 regp->crtc_830 = mode->crtc_vdisplay - 3;
563 regp->crtc_834 = mode->crtc_vdisplay - 1;
564
565 if (drm->device.info.family == NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_CURIE)
566 /* This is what the blob does */
567 regp->crtc_850 = NVReadCRTC(dev, 0, NV_PCRTC_850);
568
569 if (drm->device.info.family >= NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_RANKINE)
570 regp->gpio_ext = NVReadCRTC(dev, 0, NV_PCRTC_GPIO_EXT);
571
572 if (drm->device.info.family >= NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_CELSIUS)
573 regp->crtc_cfg = NV10_PCRTC_CONFIG_START_ADDRESS_HSYNC;
574 else
575 regp->crtc_cfg = NV04_PCRTC_CONFIG_START_ADDRESS_HSYNC;
576
577 /* Some misc regs */
578 if (drm->device.info.family == NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_CURIE) {
579 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_85] = 0xFF;
580 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_86] = 0x1;
581 }
582
583 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_PIXEL_INDEX] = (crtc->primary->fb->depth + 1) / 8;
584 /* Enable slaved mode (called MODE_TV in nv4ref.h) */
585 if (lvds_output || tmds_output || tv_output)
586 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_PIXEL_INDEX] |= (1 << 7);
587
588 /* Generic PRAMDAC regs */
589
590 if (drm->device.info.family >= NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_CELSIUS)
591 /* Only bit that bios and blob set. */
592 regp->nv10_cursync = (1 << 25);
593
594 regp->ramdac_gen_ctrl = NV_PRAMDAC_GENERAL_CONTROL_BPC_8BITS |
595 NV_PRAMDAC_GENERAL_CONTROL_VGA_STATE_SEL |
596 NV_PRAMDAC_GENERAL_CONTROL_PIXMIX_ON;
597 if (crtc->primary->fb->depth == 16)
598 regp->ramdac_gen_ctrl |= NV_PRAMDAC_GENERAL_CONTROL_ALT_MODE_SEL;
599 if (drm->device.info.chipset >= 0x11)
600 regp->ramdac_gen_ctrl |= NV_PRAMDAC_GENERAL_CONTROL_PIPE_LONG;
601
602 regp->ramdac_630 = 0; /* turn off green mode (tv test pattern?) */
603 regp->tv_setup = 0;
604
605 nv_crtc_set_image_sharpening(crtc, nv_crtc->sharpness);
606
607 /* Some values the blob sets */
608 regp->ramdac_8c0 = 0x100;
609 regp->ramdac_a20 = 0x0;
610 regp->ramdac_a24 = 0xfffff;
611 regp->ramdac_a34 = 0x1;
612}
613
614static int
615nv_crtc_swap_fbs(struct drm_crtc *crtc, struct drm_framebuffer *old_fb)
616{
617 struct nv04_display *disp = nv04_display(crtc->dev);
618 struct nouveau_framebuffer *nvfb = nouveau_framebuffer(crtc->primary->fb);
619 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
620 int ret;
621
622 ret = nouveau_bo_pin(nvfb->nvbo, TTM_PL_FLAG_VRAM, false);
623 if (ret == 0) {
624 if (disp->image[nv_crtc->index])
625 nouveau_bo_unpin(disp->image[nv_crtc->index]);
626 nouveau_bo_ref(nvfb->nvbo, &disp->image[nv_crtc->index]);
627 }
628
629 return ret;
630}
631
632/**
633 * Sets up registers for the given mode/adjusted_mode pair.
634 *
635 * The clocks, CRTCs and outputs attached to this CRTC must be off.
636 *
637 * This shouldn't enable any clocks, CRTCs, or outputs, but they should
638 * be easily turned on/off after this.
639 */
640static int
641nv_crtc_mode_set(struct drm_crtc *crtc, struct drm_display_mode *mode,
642 struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode,
643 int x, int y, struct drm_framebuffer *old_fb)
644{
645 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
646 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
647 struct nouveau_drm *drm = nouveau_drm(dev);
648 int ret;
649
650 NV_DEBUG(drm, "CTRC mode on CRTC %d:\n", nv_crtc->index);
651 drm_mode_debug_printmodeline(adjusted_mode);
652
653 ret = nv_crtc_swap_fbs(crtc, old_fb);
654 if (ret)
655 return ret;
656
657 /* unlock must come after turning off FP_TG_CONTROL in output_prepare */
658 nv_lock_vga_crtc_shadow(dev, nv_crtc->index, -1);
659
660 nv_crtc_mode_set_vga(crtc, adjusted_mode);
661 /* calculated in nv04_dfp_prepare, nv40 needs it written before calculating PLLs */
662 if (drm->device.info.family == NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_CURIE)
663 NVWriteRAMDAC(dev, 0, NV_PRAMDAC_SEL_CLK, nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg.sel_clk);
664 nv_crtc_mode_set_regs(crtc, adjusted_mode);
665 nv_crtc_calc_state_ext(crtc, mode, adjusted_mode->clock);
666 return 0;
667}
668
669static void nv_crtc_save(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
670{
671 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
672 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
673 struct nv04_mode_state *state = &nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg;
674 struct nv04_crtc_reg *crtc_state = &state->crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index];
675 struct nv04_mode_state *saved = &nv04_display(dev)->saved_reg;
676 struct nv04_crtc_reg *crtc_saved = &saved->crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index];
677
678 if (nv_two_heads(crtc->dev))
679 NVSetOwner(crtc->dev, nv_crtc->index);
680
681 nouveau_hw_save_state(crtc->dev, nv_crtc->index, saved);
682
683 /* init some state to saved value */
684 state->sel_clk = saved->sel_clk & ~(0x5 << 16);
685 crtc_state->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_LCD__INDEX] = crtc_saved->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_LCD__INDEX];
686 state->pllsel = saved->pllsel & ~(PLLSEL_VPLL1_MASK | PLLSEL_VPLL2_MASK | PLLSEL_TV_MASK);
687 crtc_state->gpio_ext = crtc_saved->gpio_ext;
688}
689
690static void nv_crtc_restore(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
691{
692 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
693 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
694 int head = nv_crtc->index;
695 uint8_t saved_cr21 = nv04_display(dev)->saved_reg.crtc_reg[head].CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_21];
696
697 if (nv_two_heads(crtc->dev))
698 NVSetOwner(crtc->dev, head);
699
700 nouveau_hw_load_state(crtc->dev, head, &nv04_display(dev)->saved_reg);
701 nv_lock_vga_crtc_shadow(crtc->dev, head, saved_cr21);
702
703 nv_crtc->last_dpms = NV_DPMS_CLEARED;
704}
705
706static void nv_crtc_prepare(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
707{
708 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
709 struct nouveau_drm *drm = nouveau_drm(dev);
710 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
711 const struct drm_crtc_helper_funcs *funcs = crtc->helper_private;
712
713 if (nv_two_heads(dev))
714 NVSetOwner(dev, nv_crtc->index);
715
716 drm_vblank_pre_modeset(dev, nv_crtc->index);
717 funcs->dpms(crtc, DRM_MODE_DPMS_OFF);
718
719 NVBlankScreen(dev, nv_crtc->index, true);
720
721 /* Some more preparation. */
722 NVWriteCRTC(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_PCRTC_CONFIG, NV_PCRTC_CONFIG_START_ADDRESS_NON_VGA);
723 if (drm->device.info.family == NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_CURIE) {
724 uint32_t reg900 = NVReadRAMDAC(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_PRAMDAC_900);
725 NVWriteRAMDAC(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_PRAMDAC_900, reg900 & ~0x10000);
726 }
727}
728
729static void nv_crtc_commit(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
730{
731 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
732 const struct drm_crtc_helper_funcs *funcs = crtc->helper_private;
733 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
734
735 nouveau_hw_load_state(dev, nv_crtc->index, &nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg);
736 nv04_crtc_mode_set_base(crtc, crtc->x, crtc->y, NULL);
737
738#ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN
739 /* turn on LFB swapping */
740 {
741 uint8_t tmp = NVReadVgaCrtc(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_CIO_CRE_RCR);
742 tmp |= MASK(NV_CIO_CRE_RCR_ENDIAN_BIG);
743 NVWriteVgaCrtc(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_CIO_CRE_RCR, tmp);
744 }
745#endif
746
747 funcs->dpms(crtc, DRM_MODE_DPMS_ON);
748 drm_vblank_post_modeset(dev, nv_crtc->index);
749}
750
751static void nv_crtc_destroy(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
752{
753 struct nv04_display *disp = nv04_display(crtc->dev);
754 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
755
756 if (!nv_crtc)
757 return;
758
759 drm_crtc_cleanup(crtc);
760
761 if (disp->image[nv_crtc->index])
762 nouveau_bo_unpin(disp->image[nv_crtc->index]);
763 nouveau_bo_ref(NULL, &disp->image[nv_crtc->index]);
764
765 nouveau_bo_unmap(nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo);
766 nouveau_bo_unpin(nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo);
767 nouveau_bo_ref(NULL, &nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo);
768 kfree(nv_crtc);
769}
770
771static void
772nv_crtc_gamma_load(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
773{
774 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
775 struct drm_device *dev = nv_crtc->base.dev;
776 struct rgb { uint8_t r, g, b; } __attribute__((packed)) *rgbs;
777 int i;
778
779 rgbs = (struct rgb *)nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg.crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index].DAC;
780 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
781 rgbs[i].r = nv_crtc->lut.r[i] >> 8;
782 rgbs[i].g = nv_crtc->lut.g[i] >> 8;
783 rgbs[i].b = nv_crtc->lut.b[i] >> 8;
784 }
785
786 nouveau_hw_load_state_palette(dev, nv_crtc->index, &nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg);
787}
788
789static void
790nv_crtc_disable(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
791{
792 struct nv04_display *disp = nv04_display(crtc->dev);
793 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
794 if (disp->image[nv_crtc->index])
795 nouveau_bo_unpin(disp->image[nv_crtc->index]);
796 nouveau_bo_ref(NULL, &disp->image[nv_crtc->index]);
797}
798
799static void
800nv_crtc_gamma_set(struct drm_crtc *crtc, u16 *r, u16 *g, u16 *b, uint32_t start,
801 uint32_t size)
802{
803 int end = (start + size > 256) ? 256 : start + size, i;
804 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
805
806 for (i = start; i < end; i++) {
807 nv_crtc->lut.r[i] = r[i];
808 nv_crtc->lut.g[i] = g[i];
809 nv_crtc->lut.b[i] = b[i];
810 }
811
812 /* We need to know the depth before we upload, but it's possible to
813 * get called before a framebuffer is bound. If this is the case,
814 * mark the lut values as dirty by setting depth==0, and it'll be
815 * uploaded on the first mode_set_base()
816 */
817 if (!nv_crtc->base.primary->fb) {
818 nv_crtc->lut.depth = 0;
819 return;
820 }
821
822 nv_crtc_gamma_load(crtc);
823}
824
825static int
826nv04_crtc_do_mode_set_base(struct drm_crtc *crtc,
827 struct drm_framebuffer *passed_fb,
828 int x, int y, bool atomic)
829{
830 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
831 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
832 struct nouveau_drm *drm = nouveau_drm(dev);
833 struct nv04_crtc_reg *regp = &nv04_display(dev)->mode_reg.crtc_reg[nv_crtc->index];
834 struct drm_framebuffer *drm_fb;
835 struct nouveau_framebuffer *fb;
836 int arb_burst, arb_lwm;
837
838 NV_DEBUG(drm, "index %d\n", nv_crtc->index);
839
840 /* no fb bound */
841 if (!atomic && !crtc->primary->fb) {
842 NV_DEBUG(drm, "No FB bound\n");
843 return 0;
844 }
845
846 /* If atomic, we want to switch to the fb we were passed, so
847 * now we update pointers to do that.
848 */
849 if (atomic) {
850 drm_fb = passed_fb;
851 fb = nouveau_framebuffer(passed_fb);
852 } else {
853 drm_fb = crtc->primary->fb;
854 fb = nouveau_framebuffer(crtc->primary->fb);
855 }
856
857 nv_crtc->fb.offset = fb->nvbo->bo.offset;
858
859 if (nv_crtc->lut.depth != drm_fb->depth) {
860 nv_crtc->lut.depth = drm_fb->depth;
861 nv_crtc_gamma_load(crtc);
862 }
863
864 /* Update the framebuffer format. */
865 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_PIXEL_INDEX] &= ~3;
866 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_PIXEL_INDEX] |= (crtc->primary->fb->depth + 1) / 8;
867 regp->ramdac_gen_ctrl &= ~NV_PRAMDAC_GENERAL_CONTROL_ALT_MODE_SEL;
868 if (crtc->primary->fb->depth == 16)
869 regp->ramdac_gen_ctrl |= NV_PRAMDAC_GENERAL_CONTROL_ALT_MODE_SEL;
870 crtc_wr_cio_state(crtc, regp, NV_CIO_CRE_PIXEL_INDEX);
871 NVWriteRAMDAC(dev, nv_crtc->index, NV_PRAMDAC_GENERAL_CONTROL,
872 regp->ramdac_gen_ctrl);
873
874 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CR_OFFSET_INDEX] = drm_fb->pitches[0] >> 3;
875 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_RPC0_INDEX] =
876 XLATE(drm_fb->pitches[0] >> 3, 8, NV_CIO_CRE_RPC0_OFFSET_10_8);
877 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_42] =
878 XLATE(drm_fb->pitches[0] / 8, 11, NV_CIO_CRE_42_OFFSET_11);
879 crtc_wr_cio_state(crtc, regp, NV_CIO_CRE_RPC0_INDEX);
880 crtc_wr_cio_state(crtc, regp, NV_CIO_CR_OFFSET_INDEX);
881 crtc_wr_cio_state(crtc, regp, NV_CIO_CRE_42);
882
883 /* Update the framebuffer location. */
884 regp->fb_start = nv_crtc->fb.offset & ~3;
885 regp->fb_start += (y * drm_fb->pitches[0]) + (x * drm_fb->bits_per_pixel / 8);
886 nv_set_crtc_base(dev, nv_crtc->index, regp->fb_start);
887
888 /* Update the arbitration parameters. */
889 nouveau_calc_arb(dev, crtc->mode.clock, drm_fb->bits_per_pixel,
890 &arb_burst, &arb_lwm);
891
892 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_FF_INDEX] = arb_burst;
893 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_FFLWM__INDEX] = arb_lwm & 0xff;
894 crtc_wr_cio_state(crtc, regp, NV_CIO_CRE_FF_INDEX);
895 crtc_wr_cio_state(crtc, regp, NV_CIO_CRE_FFLWM__INDEX);
896
897 if (drm->device.info.family >= NV_DEVICE_INFO_V0_KELVIN) {
898 regp->CRTC[NV_CIO_CRE_47] = arb_lwm >> 8;
899 crtc_wr_cio_state(crtc, regp, NV_CIO_CRE_47);
900 }
901
902 return 0;
903}
904
905static int
906nv04_crtc_mode_set_base(struct drm_crtc *crtc, int x, int y,
907 struct drm_framebuffer *old_fb)
908{
909 int ret = nv_crtc_swap_fbs(crtc, old_fb);
910 if (ret)
911 return ret;
912 return nv04_crtc_do_mode_set_base(crtc, old_fb, x, y, false);
913}
914
915static int
916nv04_crtc_mode_set_base_atomic(struct drm_crtc *crtc,
917 struct drm_framebuffer *fb,
918 int x, int y, enum mode_set_atomic state)
919{
920 struct nouveau_drm *drm = nouveau_drm(crtc->dev);
921 struct drm_device *dev = drm->dev;
922
923 if (state == ENTER_ATOMIC_MODE_SET)
924 nouveau_fbcon_accel_save_disable(dev);
925 else
926 nouveau_fbcon_accel_restore(dev);
927
928 return nv04_crtc_do_mode_set_base(crtc, fb, x, y, true);
929}
930
931static void nv04_cursor_upload(struct drm_device *dev, struct nouveau_bo *src,
932 struct nouveau_bo *dst)
933{
934 int width = nv_cursor_width(dev);
935 uint32_t pixel;
936 int i, j;
937
938 for (i = 0; i < width; i++) {
939 for (j = 0; j < width; j++) {
940 pixel = nouveau_bo_rd32(src, i*64 + j);
941
942 nouveau_bo_wr16(dst, i*width + j, (pixel & 0x80000000) >> 16
943 | (pixel & 0xf80000) >> 9
944 | (pixel & 0xf800) >> 6
945 | (pixel & 0xf8) >> 3);
946 }
947 }
948}
949
950static void nv11_cursor_upload(struct drm_device *dev, struct nouveau_bo *src,
951 struct nouveau_bo *dst)
952{
953 uint32_t pixel;
954 int alpha, i;
955
956 /* nv11+ supports premultiplied (PM), or non-premultiplied (NPM) alpha
957 * cursors (though NPM in combination with fp dithering may not work on
958 * nv11, from "nv" driver history)
959 * NPM mode needs NV_PCRTC_CURSOR_CONFIG_ALPHA_BLEND set and is what the
960 * blob uses, however we get given PM cursors so we use PM mode
961 */
962 for (i = 0; i < 64 * 64; i++) {
963 pixel = nouveau_bo_rd32(src, i);
964
965 /* hw gets unhappy if alpha <= rgb values. for a PM image "less
966 * than" shouldn't happen; fix "equal to" case by adding one to
967 * alpha channel (slightly inaccurate, but so is attempting to
968 * get back to NPM images, due to limits of integer precision)
969 */
970 alpha = pixel >> 24;
971 if (alpha > 0 && alpha < 255)
972 pixel = (pixel & 0x00ffffff) | ((alpha + 1) << 24);
973
974#ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN
975 {
976 struct nouveau_drm *drm = nouveau_drm(dev);
977
978 if (drm->device.info.chipset == 0x11) {
979 pixel = ((pixel & 0x000000ff) << 24) |
980 ((pixel & 0x0000ff00) << 8) |
981 ((pixel & 0x00ff0000) >> 8) |
982 ((pixel & 0xff000000) >> 24);
983 }
984 }
985#endif
986
987 nouveau_bo_wr32(dst, i, pixel);
988 }
989}
990
991static int
992nv04_crtc_cursor_set(struct drm_crtc *crtc, struct drm_file *file_priv,
993 uint32_t buffer_handle, uint32_t width, uint32_t height)
994{
995 struct nouveau_drm *drm = nouveau_drm(crtc->dev);
996 struct drm_device *dev = drm->dev;
997 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
998 struct nouveau_bo *cursor = NULL;
999 struct drm_gem_object *gem;
1000 int ret = 0;
1001
1002 if (!buffer_handle) {
1003 nv_crtc->cursor.hide(nv_crtc, true);
1004 return 0;
1005 }
1006
1007 if (width != 64 || height != 64)
1008 return -EINVAL;
1009
1010 gem = drm_gem_object_lookup(dev, file_priv, buffer_handle);
1011 if (!gem)
1012 return -ENOENT;
1013 cursor = nouveau_gem_object(gem);
1014
1015 ret = nouveau_bo_map(cursor);
1016 if (ret)
1017 goto out;
1018
1019 if (drm->device.info.chipset >= 0x11)
1020 nv11_cursor_upload(dev, cursor, nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo);
1021 else
1022 nv04_cursor_upload(dev, cursor, nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo);
1023
1024 nouveau_bo_unmap(cursor);
1025 nv_crtc->cursor.offset = nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo->bo.offset;
1026 nv_crtc->cursor.set_offset(nv_crtc, nv_crtc->cursor.offset);
1027 nv_crtc->cursor.show(nv_crtc, true);
1028out:
1029 drm_gem_object_unreference_unlocked(gem);
1030 return ret;
1031}
1032
1033static int
1034nv04_crtc_cursor_move(struct drm_crtc *crtc, int x, int y)
1035{
1036 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc = nouveau_crtc(crtc);
1037
1038 nv_crtc->cursor.set_pos(nv_crtc, x, y);
1039 return 0;
1040}
1041
1042int
1043nouveau_crtc_set_config(struct drm_mode_set *set)
1044{
1045 struct drm_device *dev;
1046 struct nouveau_drm *drm;
1047 int ret;
1048 struct drm_crtc *crtc;
1049 bool active = false;
1050 if (!set || !set->crtc)
1051 return -EINVAL;
1052
1053 dev = set->crtc->dev;
1054
1055 /* get a pm reference here */
1056 ret = pm_runtime_get_sync(dev->dev);
1057 if (ret < 0 && ret != -EACCES)
1058 return ret;
1059
1060 ret = drm_crtc_helper_set_config(set);
1061
1062 drm = nouveau_drm(dev);
1063
1064 /* if we get here with no crtcs active then we can drop a reference */
1065 list_for_each_entry(crtc, &dev->mode_config.crtc_list, head) {
1066 if (crtc->enabled)
1067 active = true;
1068 }
1069
1070 pm_runtime_mark_last_busy(dev->dev);
1071 /* if we have active crtcs and we don't have a power ref,
1072 take the current one */
1073 if (active && !drm->have_disp_power_ref) {
1074 drm->have_disp_power_ref = true;
1075 return ret;
1076 }
1077 /* if we have no active crtcs, then drop the power ref
1078 we got before */
1079 if (!active && drm->have_disp_power_ref) {
1080 pm_runtime_put_autosuspend(dev->dev);
1081 drm->have_disp_power_ref = false;
1082 }
1083 /* drop the power reference we got coming in here */
1084 pm_runtime_put_autosuspend(dev->dev);
1085 return ret;
1086}
1087
1088static const struct drm_crtc_funcs nv04_crtc_funcs = {
1089 .save = nv_crtc_save,
1090 .restore = nv_crtc_restore,
1091 .cursor_set = nv04_crtc_cursor_set,
1092 .cursor_move = nv04_crtc_cursor_move,
1093 .gamma_set = nv_crtc_gamma_set,
1094 .set_config = nouveau_crtc_set_config,
1095 .page_flip = nouveau_crtc_page_flip,
1096 .destroy = nv_crtc_destroy,
1097};
1098
1099static const struct drm_crtc_helper_funcs nv04_crtc_helper_funcs = {
1100 .dpms = nv_crtc_dpms,
1101 .prepare = nv_crtc_prepare,
1102 .commit = nv_crtc_commit,
1103 .mode_fixup = nv_crtc_mode_fixup,
1104 .mode_set = nv_crtc_mode_set,
1105 .mode_set_base = nv04_crtc_mode_set_base,
1106 .mode_set_base_atomic = nv04_crtc_mode_set_base_atomic,
1107 .load_lut = nv_crtc_gamma_load,
1108 .disable = nv_crtc_disable,
1109};
1110
1111int
1112nv04_crtc_create(struct drm_device *dev, int crtc_num)
1113{
1114 struct nouveau_crtc *nv_crtc;
1115 int ret, i;
1116
1117 nv_crtc = kzalloc(sizeof(*nv_crtc), GFP_KERNEL);
1118 if (!nv_crtc)
1119 return -ENOMEM;
1120
1121 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
1122 nv_crtc->lut.r[i] = i << 8;
1123 nv_crtc->lut.g[i] = i << 8;
1124 nv_crtc->lut.b[i] = i << 8;
1125 }
1126 nv_crtc->lut.depth = 0;
1127
1128 nv_crtc->index = crtc_num;
1129 nv_crtc->last_dpms = NV_DPMS_CLEARED;
1130
1131 drm_crtc_init(dev, &nv_crtc->base, &nv04_crtc_funcs);
1132 drm_crtc_helper_add(&nv_crtc->base, &nv04_crtc_helper_funcs);
1133 drm_mode_crtc_set_gamma_size(&nv_crtc->base, 256);
1134
1135 ret = nouveau_bo_new(dev, 64*64*4, 0x100, TTM_PL_FLAG_VRAM,
1136 0, 0x0000, NULL, NULL, &nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo);
1137 if (!ret) {
1138 ret = nouveau_bo_pin(nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo, TTM_PL_FLAG_VRAM, false);
1139 if (!ret) {
1140 ret = nouveau_bo_map(nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo);
1141 if (ret)
1142 nouveau_bo_unpin(nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo);
1143 }
1144 if (ret)
1145 nouveau_bo_ref(NULL, &nv_crtc->cursor.nvbo);
1146 }
1147
1148 nv04_cursor_init(nv_crtc);
1149
1150 return 0;
1151}
